summary: Surely viewership figures weren’t that good for S1 and S2.  And they still went for more seasons...Clinging to anything, really.
question: Surely viewership figures weren’t that good for S1 and S2.  And they still went for more seasons...Clinging to anything, really.
answer: I don’t know if “clinging” if the right phrase… The never said they would announce anything today. I even said I found it unlikely multiple times, as recently as 5 days ago. Today they said what they’ve always said: nothing is certain, they have hopes, we can trust they are doing everything they can to make it happen. So the disappointment people are feeling today… really, it’s on the fandom. The fandom pushed this idea that we would know for sure today, and for some it was just shitposting (I made one shitpost yesterday myself) or hopeful theories, but I saw others made it sound like it was a certainty. It never was. So yeah, we held our breaths when the time for the last speech of the day came. And everyone cried when they said goodbye, but what else could we have done when the cast and crew themselves were crying and clingging to one another? Nothing has changed since yesterday in terms of hypothetical renewal. There’s zero reason to be mad today if you weren’t yesterday.

summary: uhhh no matter how much you dislike a remake i don’t think it’s a good idea to talk to other remakes’ actors about it. even if...
body: uhhh no matter how much you dislike a remake i don’t think it’s a good idea to talk to other remakes’ actors about it. even if you talk to them about it, you shouldn’t spread info about a private conversation. we already have enough drama between remake fandoms, dragging actors into it won’t help anyone.
